decks.notes: The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to prioritize quick and aggressive plays to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off, along with efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to deal damage and control the board. Cards like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge are used to pump up creatures and push for more damage. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Expressive Iteration and Preordain to ensure consistency and keep the pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on creating a combo utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate card advantage and fueling the graveyard. It then aims to win the game by using cards like Song of Creation and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries to draw the entire deck and cast Grapeshot to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes mana acceleration with Mox Opal and Mox Amber to ensure the combo can be executed quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on cycling through cards quickly to get key creatures to the graveyard, then casting Living End to bring those creatures back onto the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Subtlety, Shardless Agent, and Endurance to disrupt opponent's strategies while building towards the combo. By utilizing creatures with powerful enter-the-battlefield effects like Steamcore Scholar and Curator of Mysteries, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence after casting Living End. The lands and spells in the deck are chosen to support this strategy and protect the combo from disruption.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures to disrupt your opponent's game plan while also controlling the board with removal and graveyard hate. By applying pressure early with efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Emperor of Bones, and disrupting their strategy with Thoughtseize and Relic of Progenitus, you can quickly overwhelm your opponent. The deck also has a flicker subtheme with cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to generate value and protect your key creatures. Finally, utilizing powerful finishers like Ketramose, the New Dawn and Overlord of the Balemurk to close out games.

This deck revolves around cycling through cards to quickly fill your graveyard with creatures, then casting Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield. The key strategy is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while setting up your own combo by cycling cards like Street Wraith and Curator of Mysteries. Once Living End is cast, you can overwhelm your opponent with a board full of powerful creatures. Additionally, cards like Force of Negation and Commandeer provide protection and disruption to help ensure your combo goes off successfully.

This deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor to enable explosive ramp plays with Primeval Titan and Scapeshift, allowing for quick and powerful combo finishes. The deck includes lands that produce multiple mana, such as Urza?s Saga and Lotus Field, as well as utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer and Explore to accelerate the game plan. The deck can generate massive amounts of mana and overwhelm opponents with big threats like Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells, removing threats, and ramping up to powerful late-game plays utilizing the Urza lands and Eldrazi creatures. It aims to stall the opponent's strategy, disrupt their plays, and eventually overwhelm them with powerful Eldrazi creatures or Ugin, Eye of the Storms. It uses a combination of card draw, removal spells, and counter magic to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent in the long run.
